page.title: 07Changing Face of Uxbridge
page.content: Uxbridge is becoming an important business centre,with road links to the West(M25 and M4) and London (M25).The buildings already constructed or planned for the town centre between 1980-1990 are mainly modern office blocks.These are rented by companies mainly concerned with industry or technology.Some of the offices are used by expanding firms,from the local industrial estate.There are plans to expand the pedestrianised shopping area and car parking facilities.A new Bus Station was recently completed. There are also plans for a new leisure and entertainment facilities,e.g a new library.Listed buildings have been refurbished e.g the Regal Cinema.The Local Planning authority aims to conserve and protect the remaining areas of Uxbridge,while ensuring new development compliments the area.
